page.title: 03THE VILLAGE OF GLADESTRY
page.content: The population is about 200 in Gladestry Parish. The centre of the villge is quite small. There are about 36 houses in the centre. The church is called St Mary's. Not many go to church. The Rectory is by the Church, but now it used for bed and breakfast. The village hall is used for dances plays and parties. Our pub's name is the Royal Oak. It is very busy some nights. The Baptist Chapel has a service once a month. Mostly old people go. The Methodist Chapel is now a house. Our shop and post office is in the same building. Not many people buy from there because it is cheaper in the Kington shops. The school is 105 years old and there are 27 children there at the moment.
